data.title: Le Tigre
data.meta_description: Le Tigre artist page: interviews, features and/or performances archived at NPR Music
data.text:
Kathleen Hanna on life as a 'Rebel Girl,' and the joy of expressing anger in public

Fresh Air

The Bikini Kill frontwoman pioneered the "riot grrrl" movement in the 1990s. "I thought of myself as a feminist performance artist who was in a punk band," Hanna says.

Kathleen Hanna on life as a 'Rebel Girl,' and the joy of expressing anger in public

Listen · 37:12 37:12

Le Tigre's feminist rage has always been fun

The synth-pop band just finished its first tour in nearly 20 years. After a recent show in Brooklyn, two longtime fans reflect on why this music still hasn't lost its power.

Review: The Julie Ruin, 'Hit Reset'

After stints in Bikini Kill and Le Tigre, Kathleen Hanna still finds new ways to rage and inspire. On her new album at the helm of The Julie Ruin, she transforms anger into a source of power and fun.

Kathleen Hanna On Working Through Illness And Focusing Anger

The icon behind two pioneering bands, Bikini Kill and Le Tigre, has a new project called The Julie Ruin. It comes after years of being sidelined from sickness and some deep thought about her own long career.

Kathleen Hanna On Working Through Illness And Focusing Anger

Listen · 9:36 9:36

Bedroom Dancing: Le Tigre By Accident

A new fan of an old record recalls first hearing the dance-punk band in high school, on a mixtape meant for someone else.
